newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Britain apologises for bringing rain to Hong Kong.
newsitem.headline: Britain apologises for bringing rain to Hong Kong.

text.p: British Foreign Secretary Robin Cook apologised on Monday for the heavy rain pouring down over Hong Kong on this final day of colonial rule in the British territory.
"I must apologise for the fact that I brought the British weather with me," he told Chinese Foreign Minister Qian Qichen.
A thunderstorm warning was in effect in Hong Kong just hours before official ceremonies, some outdoors, were due to begin on Monday leading up Hong Kong's return to Chinese rule at midnight tonight.
